text: Warning Against the Strange Woman
My child, guard my sayings;
store my commandments with you.
Keep my commands and live,
and my teaching like \add the\add* ⸤apple of your eye⸥.\f + \fr 7:2 \ft A single word meaning “pupil of the eye” \f*
Bind them on your fingers;
write them on the tablet of your heart.
Say to wisdom,\f + \fr 7:4 \ft Hebrew “the wisdom” \f* “you are my sister,”

and you shall call insight,\f + \fr 7:4 \ft Hebrew “the insight” \f* “⸤intimate friend⸥.”\f + \fr 7:4 \ft Literally “one who is known.” To “know” is often a euphemism for intercourse. Therefore “intimate friend” may also be read “lover.” \f*
\add In order\add* to guard yourself from ⸤an adulteress⸥,\f + \fr 7:5 \ft Literally “a strange woman” \f*
from the foreigner who ⸤makes her words smooth⸥.\f + \fr 7:5 \ft Literally “causes to be smooth her words” \f*
For at the window of my house,
through my lattice, I looked down.
And I saw among the simple,
I observed among the youth,
a young man lacking ⸤sense⸥,\f + \fr 7:7 \ft Literally “heart” \f*
passing on the street ⸤at⸥\f + \fr 7:8 \ft Literally “at the place of” \f* her corner,
and he takes the road \add to\add* her house,
at twilight, at \add the\add* day’s evening,
in \add the\add* midst of night and the darkness.
Then behold! A woman \add comes\add* to meet him
\add with the\add* garment of a prostitute\f + \fr 7:10 \ft Or “whore” \f* and ⸤a secret heart⸥.\f + \fr 7:10 \ft Literally “secret of heart” \f*
She is loud and stubborn;
her feet do not stay at her house.
Now in the street, now in the square,
⸤at⸥\f + \fr 7:12 \ft Literally “at the place of” \f* every corner she lies in wait.
She took hold of \f + \fr 7:13 \ft Or “strengthened” \f* him and kissed him.
Her face was impudent, and she said to him,
“Sacrifices of peace offerings \add are\add* upon me;
⸤today⸥\f + \fr 7:14 \ft Literally “the day” \f* I completed my vows.
So\f + \fr 7:15 \ft Hebrew “thus” \f* I have come out to meet you,
to seek your face, and I have found you.
\add With\add* coverings I have adorned my couch,
spreads of the linen of Egypt;
I have perfumed my bed \add with\add* myrrh,
aloes, and cinnamon.
Come, let us take \add our\add* fill of love making,
until the morning let us delight in love.
For there is no man\f + \fr 7:19 \ft Or “husband” \f* in his home;
he has gone on a ⸤long journey⸥.\f + \fr 7:19 \ft Literally “a journey from far” \f*
The bag of money he took in his hand,
for \add on\add* the day of the full moon he will come home.”
She persuades him with the greatness of her teachings;
with her smooth lips she compels him.
He goes after her suddenly;
like an ox to the slaughter he goes,
and like a stag to the instruction of a fool,
until an arrow pierces his ⸤entrails⸥,\f + \fr 7:23 \ft Literally “heaviness,” often referring to the liver \f*
like a bird rushing into a snare,
but he does not know that ⸤it will cost him his life⸥.\f + \fr 7:23 \ft Literally “it is against his life” \f*
Reiteration of the Warning Against a Strange Woman
And now, my children, listen to me,
and be attentive to the sayings of my mouth.
May your heart not turn aside to her ways;
do not stray into her path.
For many slain she has laid low,
and countless\f + \fr 7:26 \ft Or “strong men” \f* \add are\add* all of her killings.
The ways of Sheol\f + \fr 7:27 \ft A term for the place where the dead reside, i.e., the Underworld \f* \add are\add* her house,
descending to chambers of death.
